title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of current events in Greater Boston.
The quiz covers trending local stories, encouraging residents to stay informed.
Peter Chianca heads the initiative as Boston.com's general assignment editor.

title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner in the Bruins' 4-3 victory over the Sabres on Thursday.
Khusnutdinov joined Boston's top line alongside David Pastrnak after previously playing as a fourth-line winger.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised Khusnutdinov's hard work and adaptability, especially after Elias Lindholm's injury.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye significantly contributes to the Patriots' 6-2 start with 2,026 passing yards and 15 touchdowns.
ESPN’s Dan Orlovsky argues Maye is the current NFL MVP frontrunner over Colts' running back Jonathan Taylor.
Maye has the third-best NFL MVP odds at +500, behind Patrick Mahomes (+125) and Josh Allen (+350).

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm in Brookline and Loring Greenough House partner for a free farmers market in Jamaica Plain.
The market will operate the first three Thursdays in November, 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., offering free produce and bread.
Governor Maura Healey announced increased support for food banks and a new SNAP resource hub amid SNAP benefit concerns.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations was stolen from St. Patrick’s Church on Main Street in Watertown on October 27.
The theft occurred sometime after 5:30 p.m. and was reported to Watertown police the next morning.
Police have not released details about the theft or suspects; they're seeking information from the public.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm exited the Bruins-Sabres game in the second period with a lower-body injury.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm reported Lindholm would be reevaluated after appearing in pain during the game.
Pavel Zacha and Casey Mittelstadt might replace Lindholm as top-line center if injury sidelines him.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling in the World Series, batting .130 with no RBIs and zero extra-base hits.
David Ortiz advises Betts to focus on having fun and playing instinctively, like in Little League.
Dodgers' offense falters in World Series; top four hitters went 1-for-15 with eight strikeouts in Game 5.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish firefighter Terence Crosbie sentenced to 7-9 years for raping a woman in a Boston hotel.
Crosbie's conviction follows a retrial after a previous mistrial; he maintains his innocence and plans to appeal.
Prosecutors cited DNA, video, and key card evidence; victim described significant personal and professional impacts.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, from Cape Verde, was sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old in 2020.
Barbosa, who pleaded guilty, was sentenced on Oct. 27; he initially met the victim in a Taunton park.
Barbosa, in the US illegally, may face deportation after serving his prison sentence, according to officials.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the New England Patriots in October 2025.
Jones was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after standout performances in pass defense and punt returns.
Jones recorded a key interception against the Bills and ranks high in tackles and punt return yards this season.
